greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = one less than the first i >= 1 for which the Kronecker symbol K(i,n) is either 0 or -1. Or the maximal value u such that all K(1,n), K(2,n), ... up to K(u,n) have +1 as their values.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..10000
program: (PARI) A227195(n) = for(k=2, n, if(kronecker(k, n)<1, return(k-1))); \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 08 2018
xref: Bisections: A112050 (for odd terms from 3 onward), A000012 (for all even terms).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 06 2013
ext: Data section extended up to a(105) by _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 08 2018
